text: The amendment stated that the Commons should hold a vote on a PV. At the time, Labour made a point of explaining that this didn't mean it actually supported a PV, just the idea of holding a vote. Labour may back Wilson - Kyle when the time comes, let's see

text: Certainly, some of the MPs behind the cross-party amendment fear the Government is trying to "wreck" it by making empty promises. Ie "no need to vote for that, we're going to do it anyway!"

text: Of course we're also hearing now (from @GregClarkMP for one) that the govt will allow indicative votes anyway. But the question then is whether you trust the Government to keep its word (nless Greg just means it won't whip against Letwin amendment?)

text: Labour announces it is to table amendment calling for indicative votes on Monday. But hard to get this through, because Tories will feel obliged to oppose it. The question is, will Labour officially support the existing, very similar cross-party amendment?
